result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony L Jackson Sr

Defense needs to get discovery.
BTC: Matter adjourned.

Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim H.M (person, property, residence or family).

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tony L Jackson Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Tony L Jackson Sr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense informs court that defendant has Tourrettes and may have a few outbursts.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
